explain: a raised rim where the street meets the sidewalk
to shout in happiness or praise
happening at the end of something; last
an animal whose skin is covered with dry scales
the hard thin covering of a fish or reptile
an animal that lives part of its life in water and part of its life on land
an animal that lives in water and has gills
a long strip of leather or cloth worn around the waist to hold up pants
a piece of clothing without sleeves worn over a shirt
a hollow metal object that makes a ringing sound when it is hit
a home made by a bird from twigs and grass to hold its eggs
statement: The extra players for the football team sat on the bench.
After skating, the girl rested on the curb outside her house.
The audience clapped and cheered as the player scored a goal.
When the game ended, the final score was four to two.
Lizards, turtles, crocodiles, and snakes are reptiles.
The scales of a fish can be round and colorful.
Fish live in water all of their lives.
He tightened the belt around his waist so his pants would not fall down.
She wore an orange vest so the drivers could see her on the dark road.
The bell rang loudly to tell the students that class was over.
The robin built a nest in the oak tree and laid three blue eggs inside.
